groundTruth.text: AbstractThe field of gastroenterology (GI) is constantly evolving. It is essential to pinpoint the most pressing and important research questions. To evaluate the potential of chatGPT for identifying research priorities in GI and provide a starting point for further investigation. We queried chatGPT on four key topics in GI: inflammatory bowel disease, microbiome, Artificial Intelligence in GI, and advanced endoscopy in GI. A panel of experienced gastroenterologists separately reviewed and rated the generated research questions on a scale of 1–5, with 5 being the most important and relevant to current research in GI. chatGPT generated relevant and clear research questions. Yet, the questions were not considered original by the panel of gastroenterologists. On average, the questions were rated 3.6 ± 1.4, with inter-rater reliability ranging from 0.80 to 0.98 (p < 0.001). The mean grades for relevance, clarity, specificity, and originality were 4.9 ± 0.1, 4.6 ± 0.4, 3.1 ± 0.2, 1.5 ± 0.4, respectively. Our study suggests that Large Language Models (LLMs) may be a useful tool for identifying research priorities in the field of GI, but more work is needed to improve the novelty of the generated research questions.

problem.description: The challenge of systematically identifying novel, relevant, and high-impact research priorities in specialized domains (e.g., medicine, engineering, or social sciences) using automated tools like Large Language Models (LLMs), while ensuring the generated questions are both original and aligned with expert consensus.

templateData.title: Technical Framework for LLM-Based Research Prioritization in Bioinformatics
templateData.description: Structured template for evaluating technical implementations of Large Language Models (LLMs) in systematically identifying and validating high-impact research priorities in bioinformatics, with emphasis on reproducibility, domain alignment, and quantitative validation

templateProperty.label: LLM Model Architecture
templateProperty.description: Specific pre-trained LLM architecture used (e.g., transformer variant, parameter scale, or domain-adapted version)

templateProperty.label: Domain Adaptation Methodology
templateProperty.description: Technical approach for aligning the LLM to bioinformatics (e.g., fine-tuning, prompt engineering, or retrieval-augmented generation)

templateProperty.label: Bioinformatics Training Dataset
templateProperty.description: Primary curated dataset used for domain adaptation (e.g., PubMed abstracts, UniProt records, or custom corpora)

templateProperty.label: Prioritization Algorithm
templateProperty.description: Computational method for scoring/ranking research questions (e.g., novelty detection, impact prediction, or gap analysis)

templateProperty.label: Novelty Quantification Metric
templateProperty.description: Mathematical metric used to measure research question novelty (e.g., cosine distance from existing literature embeddings)

templateProperty.label: Expert Consensus Alignment Score
templateProperty.description: Quantitative measure of alignment between LLM-generated priorities and domain expert judgments (e.g., Cohen’s kappa or F1 overlap)

templateProperty.label: Literature Embedding Model
templateProperty.description: Model used to generate vector representations of existing literature for comparison (e.g., Sentence-BERT, SciBERT, or custom)

templateProperty.label: Research Gap Analysis Method
templateProperty.description: Technical approach for identifying under-explored areas (e.g., clustering of literature embeddings, topic modeling, or citation graph analysis)

templateProperty.label: Impact Prediction Features
templateProperty.description: Features engineered to predict research impact (e.g., citation velocity, author h-index, or interdisciplinary connectivity)

templateProperty.label: Validation Benchmark Dataset
templateProperty.description: Gold-standard dataset used to evaluate prioritization accuracy (e.g., historically high-impact papers or expert-curated questions)

templateProperty.label: Precision@K for Prioritization
templateProperty.description: Precision of top-K LLM-generated research questions matching the validation benchmark

templateProperty.label: Computational Cost (GPU Hours)
templateProperty.description: Total GPU hours required for domain adaptation and prioritization pipeline

templateProperty.label: Inference Latency per Question
templateProperty.description: Average time (ms) for the LLM to generate and score a single research question

templateProperty.label: Explainability Method
templateProperty.description: Technique used to interpret LLM-generated priorities (e.g., attention visualization, SHAP values, or counterfactual analysis)

templateProperty.label: Bias Mitigation Strategy
templateProperty.description: Technical measures to reduce biases in prioritization (e.g., re-ranking, demographic stratification, or adversarial debiasing)

templateProperty.label: Deployment API Endpoint
templateProperty.description: URL for the deployed prioritization service (if applicable)

templateProperty.label: Source Code Repository
templateProperty.description: Link to the GitHub/GitLab repository containing implementation details

templateProperty.label: Last Updated Date
templateProperty.description: Date of the most recent update to the model or methodology
